title: Great experience
review: We booked into Kraft Hotel, slightly sceptical about the service reading some reviews, however as we are good at traveling thought give it a go. Well hotel is absolutely spotless staff so helpful and has everything one would need. We ate here and the service was outstanding, plenty of waiting staff and not in your face. Food was plentiful and fantastic quality staff couldn't do enough. Last couple of nights we had pre dinner drinks on the lovely terrace 5th floor, the head barman was amazing with service and a chat with a smile, also little extra snack with drink The hotel is so close to all city amenities within walking distance, so would definitely recommend. Breakfast is also relaxing and plenty of choices. Great place would definitely come back

title: Beautiful Hotel with Friendly Staff
review: Great location, quiet road. Very close to the centre of Florence. Friendly staff, excellent food choices, particularly breakfast. Ideal place to stay. Rooms are clean, light and comfortable. The roof top pool was also an ideal spot for cooling off.

title: Lovely hotel, staff. room, food
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your feedback. Really happy for having made your stay pleasant and confortable.  In the hope to welcome you back in Florence we remain with our best regards  The Hotel manangement

title: Fab hotel. Loved it. Will be back
review: We came to this hotel after attending a typically Italian evening with a local Travel agents. We liked the fact that they have personally been to visit each hotel in their brochure. When we arrived we were instantly made to feel ever so welcome. Every single member of the team were so welcoming and friendly and really added value to our holiday. The hotel was spotless, the rooms the bar the pool the restaurant was so so clean!!!! We thoroughly enjoyed sitting out looking at the beautiful view of Florence this hotel offers. We stayed for four nights and two of the nights we booked in to the hotel to eat our dinner. Again we could not fault it, the service was impeccable - even giving every single person a blanket because the wind had a slight chill in it, but also the food was…

title: Beautiful rooftop
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Lovely hotel
review: We visited Florence in the middle of a heat wave and the beautiful rooftop terrace and pool made sure that we had a brilliant relaxing holiday. The staff we so friendly and accommodating. Especially Roberto who helps out with the morning service. I celebrated my birthday there and had dinner on the roof that evening, the staff made such a nice fuss over it and made it extra special. The rooms are clean and it is located a 10 minute walk from the main tourist areas which means the area is a little quiet and its walking distance to the train station. Would definitely recommend.

title: The Pool and Roof are Stunning
review: This is a lovely hotel in a quiet area about 15 mins walk from the main train station and only 15 mins walk the other way into the centre along the river. Myself, husband and teenage son spent 4 nights in a ground floor triple room. The room itself was small but was spotless and the 3rd bed was really just suitable for younger children not teenagers but we managed. The roof top pool was a godsend as there was a heat wave going on and if you went up later in the day there was always a sunbed available. Breakfast was good and always fresh and plenty of it. We only had dinner one night , food was just ok but I have to say the waitress was wonderful and I could not fault the service. Bar staff however were the total opposite. Service was very slow especially if you asked for a drink…

title: Good location, courteous staff and good facilities
review: We had a 4 night stay at this great property during a Huge Heat wave! Boy did we appreciate the pool and the excellent Air Con.  The first room we were checked into was fine, but the bathroom was a little damp, with some mould in the corner. I have mould allergies, so explained this to reception who kindly and immediately moved us to a better room the floor below, and said they completely understood.  This was much appreciated and we loved our gorgeous newly decorated room (complete with the best shower I've seen in a long while). Breakfast was delicious. I am Gluten free, and they accommodated me brilliantly at breakfast for the most part. The restaurant ran out of Gluten Free ( Senza Glutine) pasta at lunch, which was shame. We ate out every evening, so we didn't try dinner. …

title: Great hotel in beautiful Florence.
review: Hotel well placed about 10 minutes easy walk from main rail station. About twenty minutes walk into centre of Florence (Duomo, Uffizi) and very near River Arno. We had bed and breakfast. Room very comfortable: excellent shower and air conditioning. Breakfast on roof top very good variety and views of Florence were as good as you could get.  Staff very helpful.  Very good value.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Great hotel!
review: I stayed for 1 week whilst attending my son's wedding. The hotel is in a very good location 10 mins walk from the town centre but benefits from  peace,calm and quiet of this location. I had a double room for single occupancy. It was a large room with good en suite, plenty storage space and coat hangers. In all honesty it would have benefitted from a lick of paint but bed was very comfortable and bedding good quality. What makes this hotel special is the staff, the roof terrace and the pool.  All the staff from the restaurant staff, to front of house and housekeeping were so pleasant and nothing was too much trouble.  They even posted some cards for me as I couldn't find a post box. !! The housekeeping staff were very efficient, changed towels regularly and seemed to changed the…

title: Big Disappointment
review: When you get to sit and enjoy a lovely brakfast macchiato on the roof top and take in Florence, what more can you ask for? We travelled as a family and really enjoyed this hotel! Nice room, good bathroom, view from the balcony and a perfect bar, restaurant and pool on the top. Good lay out and lovely service! The pool is on an upper level from the restaurant, so those who want to catch some sun before it sets will not disturb people who are seated in the restaurant. The hotel is 8-10 minutes walk from the city centre, quiet and with great staff, at service exactly when you need them. Near by bus stops for city sightseeing, small shops and eateries to explore and valet parking. We loved to stay here - and with the pool a perfect place during summer - with or without kids. Would…

title: Mixed feelings
review: My family spent three nights at the Kraft Hotel and were very disappointed.  Water was leaking from behind the tiles in the bathroom in our room and flooding the bathroom floor.  We were obviously concerned that this was an unsanitary situation for our family.  We were told there were no other rooms, and the solution was wiping the water up with towels!  The staff were not friendly and the bartender told us we were not allowed to buy bottled water to bring back to our room.  Really, I can't buy bottled water?! The hotel does have a nice rooftop pool and restaurant! The good news is that even a horrible hotel experience can not take away from the beautiful city of Florence.

title: Best view for breakfast
review: Our experience was a bit of a mixed bag. On arrival we were told we'd been allocated a twin room not a double and was immediately offered an alternate room. We got to our room and was then contacted a few minutes later on the room phone to say we had to move rooms due to a mix up. Fortunately this was an upgraded room and was much bigger and nicer than the room we moved from. The breakfast itself was excellent with a wide selection of foods. Staff not so good, first morning we ordered 2 coffees, neither of which ever arrived, the 2nd morning we ordered the same but the milk never arrived. Roof top restaurant, bar and pool all stunning. Location really good, quite street and only a 10 minute walk into the main town along the river. Parking not on site but only a 5 minute walk…

title: Interesting hotel friendly staff and in quiet area
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Excellent hote
review: Nice hotel just reaches a 4* for the amenities with rooftop pool and terrace.  The roof terrace for breakfast and drinks in the evening is excellent.  Staff were a little slow first night to service but noticed a definite improvement the second night after seeing a very poor review of the service on here!  Euro 14 for a lager and a spritz, bit on the high side. Room was deluxe with balcony and was clean and air conditioned. The furniture which was mean to be 'antique' was actually shoddy copies that had been glued together. About ready for an upgrade but pleasant enough. Shower was poor as sprayed water everywhere! Aircon worked a treat and was quiet. Breakfast on terrace excellent with plenty of choice. Cannot comment on dinner at the restaurant as did not go due to prices! …

title: Nice hotel struggles with service on the 5th floor
review: Just got back from 5 days in Florence. We flew into Pisa and had a easy 50 min train ride from Pisa to Florence and then about a 10-15 min walk from SMN train station to the hotel. The hotel was around 10-15 min walk to the cathedral/centre of the city and was situated in a quiet residential area with easy access to the Arno river and local amenities.   Check-in was fast and easy and the staff most polite. The room was of a decent size, quiet and came with everything we needed and more. There was some minor wear and tear but no more than you would get in your own home. The bed was comfy providing a good nights sleep, bathroom clean with an adequate shower and the air-con is perhaps the best we've had.   The level 5 restaurant and pool area is quiet, relaxed and certainly not…

title: Hotel nice. Service on 5th floor bad. Avoid the restaurant.
review: The hotel is nice and the managers are trying hard, but unfortunately the staff on the 5th floor appear young and untrained. The poor managers are trying but it's hard when their staff do not understand how to serve and at times took 20-30 minutes to get a drink and at breakfast tables were left uncleared and you had to poach the plates up from the last guests, and to top that off they had run out plates and some food so had to wait for the staff. First floor concierge service was good and helpful. I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Enjoyable five nights.
review: I stayed here for a business trip and while the location is great and the room was nice (besides a room door that you had to slam in order to shut) I was quite disappointed with the service on the rooftop restaurant. I often was not greeted when I arrived and sometimes was looked at as if I were an alien when I asked for simple things such as water or a cappuccino. The wait staff appear to be teenagers who need more training on hospitality and professional conduct. To boot, the food is overpriced and pretty average. I'd only eat here if you are too tired to venture out into the city which has many amazing food options.   On the contrary, the concierge service on the first floor was super friendly. The complimentary breakfast was also good with lots of options (but again, wait…

title: a gem of a hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Great location for walkers - beautiful hotel
review: We based ourselves at the Kraft for 5 nights. A mere 700 metre walk from the station if you know where you are going - but would recommend a taxi for your arrival if you haven't been here before. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely with a small balcony. The breakfasts were great - but if you have to leave before breakfast is available don't go with the breakfast to go.. it won't be what you are expecting!! The pool area is very popular, so difficult to get a banana lounge, but very refreshing after a day of sight seeing. The rooftop bar is exquisite with fantastic views, and the dinner we ate in the hotel was fabulous. Wonderful location. Great experience!

title: Excellent hotel!
review: Dear Ms. Lorraine,  We thank you very much for your review after the stay at The Kraft Hotel.  Very happy for having given you a wonderful experience .  Our best regards  The Hotel manager

title: Lovely friendly hotel in a great location!
review: We had a lovely room - front desk service was terrific.  The terrace was beautiful - perfect for lunch and snacks.  We did not have dinner here.  But we had breakfast and snacks or drinks.  The service is terrific and prices are reasonable.  Be warned - you cannot access the terrace for sunrise.  :)  There are not a lot of local dining options.  For dinner, you will have to walk if you are eating outside the hotel. Very residential feel to the neighborhood.  Location is perfect - 1 block from the river.  It's a great location if you are a walker.  It is about a 20 minute walk to the ponte vecchio. But we found that it was lovely.  The walk from inside the city is easy - and it's very hard to get lost.   Close to the railway station (about 10 minute walk.)  Quick access to the…

title: Superb hotel, a wonderful experience
review: Dear Helen,

title: Great Family Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Stay here for the roof terrace
review: Very nice hotel with amazing views from the rooftop restaurant and pool.  We were disappointed that the pool was too cold to swim in, even with hot temperatures.  The location is nice, because it is a bit quieter but still within walking distance to the city center with both a 6 and 13 year old.  The staff were very helpful before and during our stay.

title: Classy Kraft
review: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for your review .  Your satisfaction has made our satisfaction.  With our best regards  The hotel manager

title: Hidden Gem
review: Very nice hotel in a good location within walking distance of the train station and all of the major sights. The staff are very friendly and welcoming and the hotel is generally very nice. What makes this hotel so special is it's roof terrace. It boasts spectacular panoramic views of the beautiful city that is Florence. They serve a great selection of food and drink also and you can enjoy your breakfast up here too. The terrace is on two levels, the pool at the top then the bar and eating area. We visited in May and sunbeds were plentiful. Our actual room was a bit on the small side but other than this I can't criticise this hotel at all. Don't hesitate, just book it.

title: Beyond all expectations!
review: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for your review and we are happy you appreciated our hotel services and amenities.  Your satisfaction has made our satisfaction.  With our best regards  The hotel manager

title: Incredible view!!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Decent hotel but not 4 stars
review: the highlight of this hotel is rooftop restaurant and pool. Just an amazing view. The rooms are nice and clean. The free breakfast is very good. The location is about a 15-25 minute walk to most of the major attractions so if you are not a walker expect to take some cabs.

title: Love Love Love
review: Dear Guest,  We thank you very much for your review.   Hope to welcome you again at the Kraft Hotel.

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: This is a decent hotel. The rooms are clean and they have the standard amenities. However I wouldn't consider this a four star hotel. The lobby and hallways are extremely dated, even the safe in the bedroom doesn't have a code you need to go downstairs and get a key. The location is NOT near central Florence or all of the hustle and bustle, which was a negative for us as we wanted to explore mostly by foot. Be a little weary when booking this hotel. I have stayed in plenty of hotels that were 3 stars and nicer than this.

title: Very good hotel.
review: Dear Customer,  Although your comment is mentioning some negative aspects of the hotel, we welcome it in order to be able to improve the standards of our services and amenities.  Thank you very much for your feedback. Please note a 50% of the hotel rooms have been refurbished last winter and we will carry on doing it next year in order to let the hotel come to be completed at the same standard everywhere . With our best regards

title: Week in florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Wonderful roof top pool but basic room
review: Lovely hotel. With great views of Florence. Only had a week there. Very handily placed for walking about the city, everything you could wish for is also close at hand. In my opinion the most beautiful city in the world

title: What a pleasure!
review: Dear Guest,  We really thank you about your feedback .  Our best regards

title: Absolute pleasure
review: I stayed here whilst visiting friends in Florence and booked the hotel through British Airways. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and the roof top pool was stunning with fantastic views across the city, and nice sun loungers. The restaurant looked really nice but didn't get a chance to visit unfortunately. However, I had a basic, single room, which had a balcony which was nice (although no seats on balcony), and a nice bathroom with a bath and shower. But the room itself was very small and basic. Clean and efficient, but drastically needs modernising. I would stay here again, but I would definitely pay extra for an upgraded room next time.

title: Not enough superlatives
review: Lovely hotel walking distance from Florence Central Station and major attractions. Comfortable king-sized bed, spacious room and good-sized bathroom (Best hairdryer I’ve come across in a hotel room to date!) We had room 228.  Tip: Get two room cards so that you can charge your devices while you are not in the room.  The best surprise was the deck on top of the hotel which has amazing 360 degree views of Florence. It is a great place to relax with a glass of wine after a day of sight-seeing.   If I ever go to Firenze again, I will stay here again.

title: Brilliant Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: The view from the restaurant is a bonus
review: Great Hotel to spend our last day and night in Italy after a busy wedding weekend. Staff are all very friendly. Rooftop pool and bar fantastic way to relax. We had dinner in the restaurant on the rooftop which has spectacular views. Overall a wonderful stay all round.

title: Hotel kraft
review: Dear Guest,  We really thank you about your feedback . Pleased in having given you a satisfactory experience !  With our best regards

title: Great hotel with fabulous staff
review: 15 minutes walk from the station, but you might need a map to find it. Staff welcoming, friendly and helpful, and provided a city map. Room a good size, clean , and well furnished.  There was no plug in the washbasin, but one was provided the next day. The restaurant is on the top floor, and serves breakfast and dinner.  The view across the city is wonderful, especially in the evening sun. To get the best choice of other restaurants, you need to walk into the city centre, 10 to 15 minutes along the bank of the river Arno. Downsides ... the air-conditioning was noisy and not very effective.

title: Great location
review: Great hotel. Great location! Great staff. Great breakfast! Great food in restaurant ! Great view! Love Florence and this a fantastic hotel .  Short walk to train station and all amenities. You won't be disappointed!

title: Close to SMN Stn and the Arno.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Excellent hotel and excellent location
review: This is an lovely hotel. Well kept and well run. The staff are very nice and helpful and were very accommodating when I had to change my booking 3 times due to illness - this despite the original date being fixed and unchangeable. The room was excellent, ours being on the corner had windows on the east and south elevations. The décor was exceptional, especially the ceiling which was either scumbled or rag rolled with a lower coving concealing uplighters. The arrangement of the furniture meant that the wardrobe door clashed with the en-suite door and I trapped a finger in this arrangement causing some pain and bruising. I thought the beds were rather hard but the linen was spotless and made up religiously.   The bar was in the breakfast room with access through large patio doors…

title: Book it now
review: My wife and I have just stayed in the Kraft Hotel and the whole experience was excellent. The location is only fifteen minutes walk from the mail attractions and with it being by the river easily assessable to the city and railway station. The hotel staff were there for your needs and the breakfast catered for everything to start the day off. Excellent room with plenty of space and cleaned every day.

title: Lovely Hotel - Amazing Views, Wonderful Staff!
review: This hotel is fabulous, location is awesome and the rooftop terrace wins the award for best chill out zone. Book it and enjoy the great service and everything Florence has to offer. We loved it and would stay again in a flash.

title: Rooftop Patio is Awesome! Great Breakfast
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your review .  In the hope to welcoming you again at the Kfart Hotel, we remain with our warmest regards .  The Hotel management

title: Rooftop terrace is a real treat!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Lovely Hotel
review: Absolutely loved my stay at the Kraft Hotel. It is an excellent location, within walking distance of the city centre. The room was comfortable and had a small balcony with a table which was a nice spot for a cup of tea! I was only there for a weekend but would have been very happy to stay longer!  Breakfast was really good and there was a nice selection of foods available.   The view from the restaurant and outdoor terrace is amazing. We spent an evening outside with a cocktail despite the winter weather.   Would love to return in the summer when the weather is nice enough to make use of the rooftop pool!   The staff were all very friendly and helpful, particularly on reception. Would absolutely recommend!

title: Wonderful roof top views
review: An excellent hotel close to the main railway station and a beautiful short walk along the river to the city centre of Florence. The hotel staff were excellent, the rooms were clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was great which was served in the restaurant with lovely rooftop views over Florence. We also had lunch at the restaurant which was good. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good in Most Respects
review: Dear  Guest,  Thank you very much for your good feedback you left after your stay at the Kraft Hotel.  We hope to welcome you again at the Kraft and all suggestions for a better service will be the welcome .  With our warmest regards.  The Hotel Management

title: Lovely hotel
review: Hotel around 10 minute walk from train station (once you get your bearings). Reception efficient, and room spacious. Roof top bar/terrace provides wonderful views across Florence, with a roof-top swimming pool on a mezzanine, (unfortunately closed during our February stay!). Location allows you to walk along river bank within 1 minute walk, or to explore various streets running to main attractions. Buffet breakfast wide variety of choice - staff all very friendly

title: Adequate
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: FABULOUS
review: We have just returned from a 2 day break in Florence staying at the Kraft Hotel. Whilst the hotel is situated in a great location approximately 10 minutes walk from the station and many of the tourist attractions we found the hotel to be average and very basic.   During our 2 day stay we found that we were woken at 7 on both days by builders undertaking a major refurbishment of the other rooms within our vacinity.  On returning to our room about 6 exhausted after a day of sight seeing and in need of a well earned rest we found that the building works continued Well in to the evening and continued till after 8! It was impossible to relax with so much noise coming from the room immediately  next to ours and choose to leave our room immediately after changing to escape the constant…

title: A Good Hotel
review: Fantastic hotel.  The restaurant is on the top floor with brilliant views overlooking Florence.  No where better to have dinner or breakfast.  The staff were attentive and the food was out of this world.  I cannot praise it enough, and this is where my partner proposed............What more can I say

title: Lovely hotel
review: Our recent stay was very comfortable and we were made to feel very welcome. Great view from roof terrace and about 15 minute walk from Station. Also around 15 mins from Cathedral which is a must visit during any stay. Breakfast was OK although not very much choice. Rooms are spacious with 4 English news channels.

title: Definitely going back here!
review: Good location. Easy access from train station. Friendly helpful staff. Lovely decor. Room and bathroom were immaculate. Lovely spacious rooms with cute balcony overlooking street. Clean crisp sheets. Breakfast was delightful with a stunning rooftop view of the ancient city. Absolutely loved our stay and would definitely recommend it.

title: Lovely hotel, excellent service.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Italian Travels - Good, Bad, & Ugly...Kraft Hotel
review: An excellent hotel a little way from the city centre of Florence, but within easy walking distance to the main railway station and city centre. My daughter and I walked safely along the beautiful river front to and from our hotel even at night from the city centre. The hotel staff were excellent, the rooms were clean and very comfortable and our included breakfast was great which was served in the restaurant with lovely rooftop views over Florence.I would definitely stay there again.

title: All good stuff, lovely location and awesome staff
review: Dear Sir / Madam,  Thank you very much for your feedback .  We really appreciate your satisfaction after your stay and we hope to welcome you agian at the Hotel Kraft.  With our warmest regards.  The management

title: Comfortable Hotel, very welcoming staff
review: The Kraft Hotel is the 3rd hotel we stayed at on our Italian vacation.  This hotel was the hotel I stayed at for my birthday. Here are my thoughts on the Kraft Hotel in Florence, Italy:  GREAT - let me add this category because what was great was the city of Florence. Loooooved Florence, my favorite city in Italy (thus far)!!!  Good - It was a nice hotel, nothing extraordinary. The best part of the hotel was the rooftop view - GORGEOUS!! The rooftop pool was very nice as well. I enjoyed the breakfast, it was a good variety of food and was beautifully displayed each morning.   The front desk staff was very polite and helpful.  Teresa, I think that was her name, was very helpful and able to get us a reservation at a great restaurant for my birthday.  The restaurant, Trattoria dei…

title: Perfect location
review: Dear Guest,  We really thank you for  your review and we are definitively glad for having made your stay  a great one.   With our best regards.  The management

title: Lovely comfortable hotel with spacious rooms and excellent furniture
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Very fit for Florence
review: We stayed in this lovely hotels for two days. It offers excellent facilities including lovely Venetian style breakfast and top of the roof swimming pool. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are well furnished and offers wi-if facilities. It is located approximately 5 minutes away from the main town centre and railway station. Excellent public transport services available right outside the hotel.

title: Amazing romantic getaway
review: The location is good, as you may want to visit Florence, hire a car or go by train. It is 5 min to the rent a car offices, to Santa Maria Novella station and 10 min to the center. The room was clean, bath with all facilities, breakfast rich. The restaurant offers some dishes, esquisite, staff is friendly. I highly recommand this hotel.

title: Comfortable, clean and nicely furbished hotel
review: I took my wife here for our anniversary and the staff were amazing. We got a free bottle of prosecco and a room upgrade which was very generous. The breakfasts were fab and it was a nice location close to the train station and only a 10 min walk to city centre. The hotel was immaculate and had large rooms. Will definitely be looking to return here.

title: As everyone says, the view of Florence is very nice.
review: Hotel staff are helpful and know how to speak English.  The hotel itself is situation about 10 to 15 minutes away from the old part of the city (Ponte Vecchio and Duomo) but it's a nice walk along the river bank and if it's not raining :)  The rooms are clean and nicely furnished with quiet surroundings. The hotel offers parking off-site facilities but if you are lucky enough, you can try to find parking in one of the side streets.   Also worthy of note is the excellent breakfast. This is served on the 5th floor which also has a large verandah from where one can admire the city of Florence.  It was surely a nice experience to start the day such a beautiful view.

title: Nice Hotel With a Great View from the restaurant
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Comfortable hotel and convenient to city centre
review: Nice room--Functional with good location.  The breakfast buffet was a nice surprise:  nice rolls, pastry--cappuccino.  Nice selection of salami and cheeses. The rooftop view was amazing.  The service was great:  When I took my cappuccino to the terrace--one of the wait staff immediately brought out a cushion for my chair and an ashtray.

title: Florence short break
review: Dear Guest,  We really appreciate your feed back after your stay at the Kraft Hotel.  Our satistaction in receiving such a review is great. In the hope to welcome you again in our hotel, we remain with our warmest regards.  Hotel kraft

title: The restaurant and bar staff were amazing, great service, lovely Hotel
review: The Reception staff were welcoming; the reception area was warm and comfortable.  The rooms were lovely and smart and the bedsheets were crisp and the towels were fluffy.  There was coffee/tea facilities in the room.  a very good selection of food for breakfast and it appeared to be a popular venue for groups. We went with three other couples and one of the couples was upgraded to a suite which was just marvellous.

title: Hotel in a great location.
review: Great Hotel. Friendly staff with a good breakfast. Stayed here with friends using this hotel as a base for exploring Florence. Only 10 mins walking to the train station and about 20 minutes to the cathedral. Very nice roof top bar and outside seating area, there is a small pool but we were there at the wrong time of year to use it. Found some nice restaurants and bars nearby. Would have no issue returning to this hotel again.

title: Everything wonderful except pillows
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Beautiful view
review: We stayed for 5 nights all good except having to ask for more tea and coffee and very hard pillows. The staff are wonderful each desk person being more helpful and pleasant than the next. Nothing was too much  trouble the same  in the restaurant. It was a very easy walk to the station taking 8 mins wheeling our cases. Being close to the river it was easy to orient ourselves and walk everywhere except on one wet evening when we took a taxi. As two older women we felt completely safe in the area. The bus tour of Florence not really recommended as it can't go into pedestrian centre and walking so easy. Red route good to see surrounding area.

title: Great hotel and amazing city!
review: A lovely central hotel, nice and clean. Comfy bed. Good size rooms and bathrooms.   Beautiful panoramic view, little swimming pool, cafe bar and restaurant. Super nice and helpful staff.   Regards to the manager

title: Comfortable hotel
review: Good location, close to the bridge Ponte Vecchio. Very friendly staff, at reception and in the restaurant, which I recommend. We had a family studio, which was very large and with a great atmosphere. Very clean and maintained. The restaurant and the rooftop bar and pool are amazing, the view leave you speechless! We will definitely visit again Florence and Hotel Kraft!

title: Rooftops of Florence
review: I was travelling with a group and this was the allocated hotel. My room was comfortable and very clean. I was given a room for a disabled person as the bathroom had no shower curtain and there was also a seat where one could shower. Breakfast was served on the roof and we were afforded a lovely view of Florence. The breakfast was the same as was provided in every hotel we stayed at and was generous and well presented. I dined at that restaurant the next night and as well as enjoying the beautiful evening view of Florence I had the best risotto I had ever had. The hotel is walking distance from many major attractions.

title: NIce hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Excellent
review: Nice hotel, located close to center. Rooms are spacious right and clean. There are balconies in many rooms. Breakfast is a bit boring and same everyday, but ok. Staff is very nice and helpful.During the summer you can enjoy roof pool.

title: Great location
review: A really pleasant hotel 15minute walk from the main centre. The roof terrace is a real bonus. Staff were all very helpful and rooms were clean and spacious. We had an excellent meal in the hotel and the choice for breakfast was really good. A lovely place to come back to after a hectic day out. The walk along by the river is very relaxing. I would recommend.

title: Old style Florence hotel with old style charm
review: This hotel was charming with a very helpful and efficient staff.  We walked to many places because it was centrally located and near the Arno River.  The room was clean with a private balcony. I would stay here again when in Florence.

title: Lovely hotel with classical Florentine charm
review: the hotel was a 15 minute busy walk over cobble stones and loads of traffic but do-able and not too hard if you dont have too many bags! The roof top garden was lovely and the restaurant was nice too with decent food. breakfast was ok, not outstanding..  They gave me a kettle for my room which is important for me, and the staff were helpful and nice. The rooms were very old with old furntiture but thats the style of the hotel. The bathroom was upgraded and lovely and everything worked fine.  The street is really quiet and close to the river which makes a really nice walk to the major points of interest.

title: Nothing special
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Rooftop facilities are the highlight
review: We stayed in this hotel for one night and would say it wasn't that special. Room was not too tidy and it was a bit noisy during the night. The breakfast was quite poor and service in the hotel was not good enough. Have to say I was disappointed after paying 150€/night for this experience. Wanted to give some feedback when checking out but the staff didn't even ask our opinion about our stay.

title: Great Hotel, good location
review: We were most impressed by the helpfulness of the staff.  We arrived at mid-day, prior to our room being ready, to find our luggage safely installed in the room upon our return.  The shower was one of the best we've encountered in Europe, and the bed very comfortable. The location is excellent as it is close to the railroad station, the main attractions and the river.  However, for me it was breakfast and evening cocktails on the rooftop that differentiates this property from the rest.  On a sunny morning, being able to enjoy coffee overlooking the city was amazing, and again in the evening, sipping a glass of prosecco or an after dinner drink was equally magical. We'd like to give a special shout-out to Salvatore, our engaging bartender.

title: Florence mini break
review: Very nice, updated hotel.  Rooms were clean and staff was friendly.  Hotel layout is different but each room seems nice.  Nice pool on the roof and lovely rooftop dining for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Food was good.  At night they had music on the deck which was very enjoyable.

title: A favourite
review: My views were similar to others in that this is a nice hotel in a quiet area, probably about a 20 minute walk from the main tourist attractions. The common areas were lovely, especially the roof top bar and restaurant. The waiters and bar staff were brilliant. I really liked the roof top pool area, but it was quite small and so not always possible to get a lounger which were all spaced very closely together, so not entirely relaxing.however overall this was ideal for what we wanted from our city break and I thought the hotel was extremely good value for the money we paid.

title: Amazing hotel!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Excellent
review: I recently stayed here with my sister Lain we shared a double room which was ideal for the two of us, clean and spacious.  The hotel rooftop bar and restaurant is perfect for relaxing and for a few drinks in the evening but I most enjoyed taking in the view at breakfast - when even accommodated my gluten diet! Great location just 5 min walk from Domo and main shops. I would definitely recommend and return.  Katie xx

title: Lovely find
review: Terrific hotel. Good food. Nice staff. Beautiful room with a balcony. Central, but away from traffic. Nice pool on the roof. Fantastic restaurant on the roof which is partly indoors and partly outdoors with a beautiful view. Very clean.

title: Gem in Florence! Best for families & couples
review: This is a lovely hotel not far from the Ponte Vecchio . Good size rooms ,very pleasant  restaurant and bar staff. A good breakfast .As the weather was still nice and warm at the beginning of September we had a few evening meals sat outside on their rooftop restaurant which we thoroughly enjoyed.

title: Excellent hotel
review: Amazing stay for a family of 4 with a 7 year old. We chose this hotel because it was top rated on several sites including Forbes and trip advisor as one of the best Florence hotels geared for families. Our room was gorgeous and our bathroom super modern. The staff especially at the bar and terrace were lovely. The hotel is walking distance to the key churches and historical sites and a 10-15 min walk to the ponte vecchio. Great location overall and it was a $6-7 euro taxi ride from the Santa Maria novella train station! There is a pool and a beautiful terrace which we've enjoyed and taken lovely pictures of the city.

title: Ideal for our trip
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Lovely view
review: Stayed here with 4 friends, hotel suited us well, we had a triple and double rooms near to the foyer, both very quiet, only the aircon was noisy, bathroom adequate, and comfy beds,  Had 2 evening dinners on the rooftop, both of which we enjoyed very much, handy if you don't want to go back out after a long day sightseeing as we did as its a wee walk to other restaurants, breakfast was fine for us girls, our men folk may have struggled, ( big appetites)  We used the pool area later on one afternoon for a read and rest, water very cold but no smells The staff were friendly enough in the hotel and fixed us up tours and taxis We were each given a packed breakfast on our last morning as we were away too soon, the only let down of our whole trip, packets of dry biscuits, pot of jam!…

title: Excellent Staff
review: Great view  of Florence from the terrace where you have breakfast! The suite was comfortable with a nice terrace also. They should at least warm the pool a little ,the water was freezing. !! Its a 15 minute walk to the Duomo  from the hotel and the neighborhood is quite so it's ok for a good sleep.

title: Did the job.
review: We stayed in 4 hotels in Italy and this was our favorite! Beautiful room and spacious enough for my husband, me and our twin 13 year old daughters. WiFi was working, breakfast was delicious, great variety of food, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We loved the view of Florence from the rooftop restaurant. We had a problem with our rental car and ended up arriving at the hotel at 1:30am, rather than 5pm as we intended. We contacted the hotel and they were ready to help us with directions and our luggage when we arrived. The day staff was able to make us reservations at the Uffizzi for the next day! Highly recommend.

title: Nice size for europe
review: We had a massive family room in this hotel. It was just huge. Big bathroom too. Balcony with seating as well. Very comfortable but a well worn hotel. In need of a bit of tlc and upgrading. Seems to get a lot of tour groups. Rooftop pool though small was great to have . Kids cooled off. Large outdoor rooftop bar area with amazing views over Florence and the duomo.  Breakfast was really hit and miss . One day good next day not so. Pretty basic breakfast actually. Found the breakfast staff and pool and bar staff very helpful and pleasant but the reception staff really were indifferent. Hotel well located . 10-15 minute walk by the river to the ponte vecchio. Lots and lots of excellent restaurants to choose from. Overall it was grand and did the job.

title: Birthday celebrations
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Beautiful views
review: The hotel Kraft is an amazing place with views over the city from the rooftop.  Its fab having breakfast in the morning overlooking the city and in the evening whilst drinking a cocktail.  Room was sufficient enough and as it was a special birthday they had left wine and nuts on arrival.  Staff were very friendly and the morning waiter puts us to shame speaking about 6 different languages.  amazing city and will be returning next year.  Its not an overly big hotel and the rooftop pool would have been nice just a little cold when we went.

title: Birthday celebration
review: I stayed  there  with my two  young children and he had  a  wonderful  stay ,very cheerful staff.The  roof top dining area had such amazing views. Enjoyed the delicious food and the restaurant staff were excellent  especially Alex and Gaitano and you didn't feel  rushed at all, they even took time to  joke  around with my kids.The evening  front desk lady was soo helpful and even kindly  booked a table for us in Fiesole .The pool was not at all crowded The room was very beautiful and clean. The hotel is a walking distance to most of places .loved it

title: Good hotel in quiet spot
review: Kraft is good. Situated very centrally in a quiet neighborhood with no disturbing traffic. Excellent service by staff. Rooms and especially noisy air conditioning needs to be updated. Roof pool popular after a hot day in Florence.  Value for money.

title: Amazing views , quiet hotel walking distance to all attractions
review: Our family of 5 stayed here for a week in two rooms . The rooms were very clean and one had a lovely balcony to sit out on at night. Breakfast was great up on the amazing panoramic rooftop restaurant. The waiter and waitresses were all fantastic. There was a great variety of sweet breads, meats, cheese, smoked salmon, bacon and scrambled egg every morning. The pool was really clean and nice to come back to after walking around Florence all day. The hotel is in a great spot. It's in a quiet area away from the centre but just a 15  min walk along the river Arno to ponte vecchio. There were a couple of things that let the hotel down for me. First the rooms were a bit tired and also the corridors. And second was our bathroom. It was spotless but because there was no ventilation fan…

title: Nice hotel close to Florence centre
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Hotel with a view - the best view of Florence.
review: It was a good hotel, clean room (specially the bedding and the bathroom), staff is EXCELLENT they really are the ones that make you feel at ease. They were not too much into your face, but there if you needed something or just a chat, at breakfast. My room was a bit noisy, I could hear the other people in the room next too me everytime they took a shower, and when this happens during the night or at 5-6am it wakes you up, it was like water running in my room. The walls in the room could do with some new painting, there were many scratches. Breakfast was good.

title: Really nice staff especially in the bar and pool area
review: We spend 6 nights here at the Kraft Hotel and had the most wonderful stay. Our room had a lovely balcony at the front of the Hotel. Our room was beautiful with a very comfortable Super king bed. The best feature of the Kraft Hotel has to be the rooftop restaurant. The view is stunning and really takes your breath away. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The food is good but not the best (although I highly recommend the seafood gnocchi and the ravioli). The decaf coffee is better at breakfast than in the evening which is a strange observation but that is what we found! If you are planning to do lots of exploring and want to be able to walk to/ from your hotel/ sights of Florence then the Kraft Hotel may be a bit too far away for you. We walked some days but also got taxis…

title: Great hotel!
review: stayed at the kraft hotel, the staff were really friendly rooms clean and has a welcoming pool and brilliant pool side waiters. Alessandro was brilliant. The hotel was in a brilliant location, central to everything.

title: Great hotel – would definitely recommend.
review: Loved this hotel! It was within walking distance from the trains and close to the sights! The roof top dining and bar was my favorite! The views are stunning! Great customer service, no complaints at all! I hope to stay here again one day!

title: Wedding anniversary
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Wow wow wow
review: The hotel is within easy walking distance of the main train station and not that far from the centre of town.  The location is quiet and traffic was minimal (our room faced the river). The only downside to being on the 4th floor was that our room was situated directly under the dining room. As a result, we could hear a lot of noise at breakfast time (not a problem if you're an early riser tho).  The best thing about this hotel was the rooftop terrace with its wonderful views of the city. We enjoyed post dinner drinks on the terrace most evenings and loved the comfy chairs! Our one meal was pleasant enough,  but if I'm honest, not as good as I would have expected from a 4 star hotel. I don't recommend the duck. The service, however, was great and the staff were helpful and…

title: Loved the roof-top Resturant
review: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of our holiday, booked through secret escapes. What a truly wonderful hotel!! On arrival we were greeted by wonderful staff, checking in couldn't have been easier or quicker, they guy then gave us a small map of the area, marking off the location of the hotel and points of interest, a real help to us!! Our room was beautiful, just missing a view as we were on the ground floor, the bed was HUGE and so comfortable, the bathroom was fantastic, a large walk in shower, the complimentary toiletries were amazing too. We needed have worried about not having a view in our room, a short lift journey to the top floor and you have breathtakingly beautiful panoramic views of Florence. There's a small  swimming pool (which we never got the chance to use,…

Had a good stay at the Kraft in Florence - the hotel is conveniently situated to the city center and In a quiet area - so no noise to interrupt a much needed sleep after a day walking well-trodden routes - the roof-top Resturant has a stunning view at night - and reasonable food - some of the Resturant staff were really friendly and helpful. The rooms are 'tired' as is the rest of the hotel but it's good enough for a long weekend if you can survive the hard beds! Loved Florence - the food alone is good enough reason to return one day X

title: Nice hotel rooms and friendly staff
review: Love this hotel. Pretty easy to find and close to the train station. Especially love the pool!  Taxis are a little expensive if you're not used to euros but you can pretty much walk anywhere here or take a bus.   They also have a buffet breakfast and lots of great little restaurants nearby.

title: Great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Lovely hotel in a good location
review: The hotel is in a great location about a ten minute walk along the river to the Ponte Vecchio. There are lots of restaurants within a couple of minutes walk.   They have a rooftop bar/restaurant with stunning views of the Il Duomo in the distance but both nights we were there it was booked for private functions hence the reason I've knocked a star off - the hotels does make a feature of the bar in its advertising so for it not to be available is a bit off.   The room was large enough, high ceilings giving it a sort of grand feel although the furniture etc aren't grand the overall feel was a pleasant one.   Its quite a cheap hotel in the scheme of things and I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing Roof Top Views ,delicious dinner  and breakfast at Roof top restaurant too.
review: I have just returned from a week stay at the hotel with my 2 teenage daughters booked through Jet 2 . Lovely Hotel which us about a 10 mins stroll from all the hustle and bustle of the main centre of Florence. It is also 10 mins away if that from the main Santa Maria Novella station , which us where the Pisa airport bus arrives and departs from and most of the trips , which was great. Rooftop pool and sunbathe area was a god send after all the sight seeing and views from here breathtaking . Only complaint would be not enough sun lounges but I appreciate this was summer holidays and space is limited. Pool never too busy. Plenty of Seats also. The restaurant is also on the roof area and we had a couple of meals there which were delicious and good service. Breakfasts are also…

title: Wonderful hotel in every way!
review: Part of my Rome,Florence,Venice 50th Birthday Trip from my Husband...sharing twin room with half Italian girlfriend.Lovely atmosphere with Very friendly staff. Fantastic views from magical evening restaurant , A child size roof top swimming pool, Beds a little hard for us but clean, lovely shower.Discount voucher for 1st meal in restaurant.Hotel close to bridges/water  and easy walk into main attractions.

title: Comfortable hotel in a quiet area
review: The Kraft Hotel is a fantastic choice for anyone visiting Florence. It is ideally situated with lovely spacious bedrooms, friendly, helpful staff and delicious food. The pool and terrace are on the roof with fabulous views of the city. It provides one of the only large terraces in Florence - the food and ambiance make it a very special place! We will definitely be back and highly recommend the Kraft Hotel!

title: Wonderful stay in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Woderful Hotel
review: The Kraft Hotel was very central and only a 10 minute stroll to the city centre along the riverside. The roof terrace was a lovely place to sit with a glass of fizz at the end of a day in the city. Evenings on the roof terrace were memorable and the food was good. The views from the terrace were amazing! The breakfast were fantastic and the staff friendly and very helpful. I will certainly stay in the Kraft a Hotel again when I next visit Florence

title: Mixed review
review: We have been visiting this hotel for over 30 years. It is the most delightful hotel we have ever stayed in , staffed by very friendly , helpful , charming  people. It is a privately run establishment which provides excellent accommodation. The rooms are beautifully decorated to a high standard and always spotlessly clean . After a day out , you can relax on  the roof terrace and enjoy a swim in the hotel pool . At night , you can enjoy a most spectacular view of Florence from the roof terrace  whilst enjoying a pre-dinner drink  - this hotel is a must

title: Rooftop view
review: I would have loved to give this hotel a 5 as its rooftop pool and the view from the bar are AMAZING! I think possibly one of the best views in Florence. Unfortunately I only scored this hotel a 3 as our room was very average. We were on the bottom floor and were not able to receive wifi - despite this being part of our hotel package deal. Also, each morning we were awoken super early by the construction work going on across the road. I would stay again but would definitely be asked to be placed on one of the upper floors rather than level 0.

title: This was an amazing hotel!!!
review: The stay at Kraft Hotel is worth it for the Rooftop alone.  Incredible views of Florence and surrounding areas from the rooftop pool and restaurant.  Hotel is clean, service was friendly.  Location was just a short walk away from all the touristy sites in Florence - just far enough to be outside of it as well.  Great spot!

title: An oasis in a hot busy city
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Friendly, comfortable, roof top terrace restaurant.
review: We where a family of four (two adults, two kids) staying for a week. We chose the hotel mainly because of the room size, air conditioning and the pool area on the roof.  The room standard was good. I'm not a fan of wall-to-wall carpets and perfumed cleanings products, but those where the only two negative things with the room/cleaning. The bathroom was very nice and clean with all the things we needed. The beds where nice and firm, there was air conditioning and a small balcony. The hotel lies in a fairly quiet neighborhood and we where on the fourth floor so there where never any noises that disturbed the sleep.  The pool area on the roof was a nice place to hang out during the hot afternoons. The pool is small but never overcrowded and the water was cool and refreshing.…

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed at Kraft Hotel for two nights as part of a 7 day Secret Escapes holiday. It is nearby the railway station - we arrived from Rome by train. It is fairly well placed for City as well, a pleasant walk along the river or wind your way through the streets. It is a traditional building, tall ceilings and shuttered Windows. The rooms are comfortable as too are the beds. Breakfast is great served on the roof top terrace overlooking the city of Florence with lots of choices, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, breads, croissant, pastries, cakes, bacon, egg, cheese cold meats...basically continental plus plus. Coffee is made to you request by staff and served to you at the table. Great way to start your day....a leisurely roof top breakfast with great coffee.

title: Not what you see on the photos
review: Hotel is a fantastic location for visiting Florence and other cities in Tuscany and further a field. it is situated only a short walk from the centre of Florence and is about a five minute walk to the main railway stations from which we travelled to venice, Pisa, Siena and Rome. Breakfast was delicious and varied as was dinner and the view from the terrace over the rooftops of Florence is superb.

title: great location and views
review: Sadly I booked Kraft Hotel for 5 nights in July and the room was absolutely awful.  Mould on the bathroom ceiling, no ventilation in the bathroom so the smell took over the whole room.  The tiles in the bathroom were full of mould between them.  We even had workmen come into the room and leave a screwdriver and pliers in the bathroom.  The room itself was shabby, not what is advertised on the website.  The mini bar only had water in it.  The pool was small, the pool shower had a loose guard rail, no one slip and you could easily end up in the pool or at worst end up in the street below.  The pool itself is small and the sun loungers are also looking tired and shabby, with some dark mouldy stains on them.  When I complained I was told that the photos shown on the website were…

title: Phenomenal experience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location, functional & relaxed
review: We absolutely loved this hotel - the staff were very accommodating and soooooo nice - Luciano went above and beyond with our room accommodations there was an issue but he very professionally resolved in a timely manner - the complementary breakfast was one of the best - and Roberto with his kindness and tentativeness made it all that much better- the room was just newly refinished and was elaborately decorated couldn't have ask for a better experience and the location was close by everything without crowds.  And the pool was refreshing after a hot day of touring florence sights.  We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Could be better
review: 5-10 minutes to the heart of the city. A walk you need after eating & drinking as much as we did. Tired decor but exceptionally clean, relaxed service but all in keeping with the holiday feeling. Breakfast a little iffy but edible, roof top bar and pool super, especially after the 35'C days we had. Would definitely go back and recommend.

title: Great small hotel with pool
review: The Kraft Hotel has clean rooms, nice staff and it's qt walking distance from the centre.  The food in the hotel restaurant is not good not bad. It's average (for Italians)  The first night our room had water coming from the walls, and the staff handled it great!  But it is not what they say they are. It's good, but not great.  Ow  The pool is very small, and when we were there, there were a lot of American guest. Very noisy and loud.

title: Great Location, Poor Staff.
review: My wife and I and several friends stayed for four nights while sightseeing in Florence. This is a great medium priced hotel in a very good location with a great roof top pool. The location is quiet and convenient- it is still a 15 min walk from the Duomo, but it is walkable. The room was lovely. The staff for the most part was friendly. What put it over the top for us was the roof top pool, restaurant/bar area for relaxing after a hot day sightseeing.

title: Perfecrt Location!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Excellent hotel, near the Ponte Vecchio, walking distance of city centre
review: Lovely hotel, 3 of us stayed in one room and it was spacious enough for us to not feel crowded. The location is of course fabulous and is walking distance to everything. It is in a quiet residential and hotel neighbothood.

title: Wonderful hotel for our honeymoon
review: This is the most excellent hotel to stay, if you want to make a city trip to Firenze !! A nice Hotel with very kind staff. The room we stayed in, was very big, but also a bit ould fashioned ; but clean. The terrace on the rooftop, with nice overview of the city is breathtaking. The food is also very good and the staff try to speak english, in an italian way. They are soooooo kind.

title: Good location and ample space in rooms
review: This hotel was great for our honeymoon. Nice big rooms lovely decor. Clean bathrooms. Cleaners came in every day.  We stayed Bed and breakfast. Breakfast was continental with bacon and egg if you wanted it.  The rooftop pool was perfect you could see everything from up there. And we even had a day where we had the pool to ourselves for a few hours.  Would definately recommend a visit.

title: Like going back home
review: Neighborhood location a few blocks from the main city streets of Florence. Easy walking access to all locations. Close to the City Sightseeing bus stop and River. Rooftop breakfast offered a great view to take in the day and included meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, breads, fruit and more. Valet parking was the best option if visiting by car. Room was comfortable with a large bathroom and small balcony for stepping out to sit and enjoy the neighborhood.

title: Very nice hotel and friendly helpful staff.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Very very good stay
review: First time to visit Florence. This room offered more space than some of the others. It was quiet, light filled and an enjoyable stay. I stayed on the first floor in a corner room which looked over the street. It was pleasant to open the large windows and allow the breeze to come in the room. I would stay here again.

title: Brilliant Hotel
review: V nice hotel and a good locality with a nice balcony overlooking a garden....spacious rooms and good toilet items provided in the bathroom....nice terrace restaurant and the manager and waiters also polite and courteous.....a must stay for anyone going to Florence.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Had a wonderful stay at Hotel Kraft. We stayed in the 3 person room with 3 single beds. Very comfortable and clean. The room was of the period of the building and had lovely furniture however the bathroom was modern and well appointed. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive. The terrace bar area has excellent views over the city and the outdoor pool on the roof is the perfect place to unwind.  The food was excellent. I particularly enjoyed my morning capuccino. I will definitely be back.

title: Mum and Daughter time
review: The hotel is spot on for a great break. The staff work very hard to please all customers and the hotel has a very informal feel. Breakfast has a good range and will have something for everyone from salmon to Nutella ! We ate in the rooftop restaurant 3 times and the quality was great with the peppered steak a treat. Breakfast and all dining and drinks is on the roof top that provides spectacular views of the centre which is a 10 min walk away. Would visit again!

title: Exceptional, highly recommended
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Delightful Hotel in many ways
review: Enjoyed wonderful week here visiting Florence for a family wedding.  Fantastic location, easy walk to all main places of interest. Good local bus service and one tram stop to SMN station. Stunning view from roof top restaurant bar, fabulous quality food and brilliant service. Rooms immaculately clean and comfy.   Best thing about Kraft though is the really exceptional staff in all parts of the hotel, so friendly, helpful and professional.

title: Great visit !
review: Quiet and clean and good sized room,  great bathroom and shower, own little balcony with chair,lovely and safe walk day or night along river into town, roof top breakfast a plus, end of days touring sunset on roof top with spritze in hand can be amazing . And evening meal very good efficient and professional if u r around.

title: There's much to praise about the Kraft Hotel - We will return!
review: Wow ! The staff exceptionally friendly! Thxs  Roof top dining exceptional ! Food was great ! We are a family of 4 ! Daughter 1st Anniversary ! Would recommend to all ! Nice Balcony and spacious rooms Bill & Michele

title: Relaxing
review: There's much to praise about the Kraft Hotel, from the moment we arrived late on the Saturday night to the moment we left on the Saturday afternoon, we were dealt with professional and diligent staff. The location is very good (its 10 minutes from the train station - As a tip, just use google street maps to check out the route - its too easy to get lost with one missed turn)  We had a triple (family) room which was clean, reasonably large and with a high ceiling. The only negative is the limited wardrobe space which is basically a cupboard. This makes life more difficult than it should be if you are staying for a number of nights ( we stayed 7). That said, at least we could hang the main items and lay other clothing on the back of the two chairs. We were surprised by the lack of…

title: Wonderful
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Excellent location
review: My family of four stayed here for three nights.  We walked everywhere in Florence.  Hotel was nicely located.  People were extremely nice and hospitable.  Room was great.  Pleasant evenings on the roof.  Great breakfast.  Excellent dinner.  Perfect without being expensive.

title: Kraft Hotel
review: Just returned from a wonderful week in Venice and Florence. This hotel is minutes from the railway station and five minutes walk from the ponte vecchio bridge. All other places of interest are close by. Our room was very comfortable and clean and had a nice balcony. Great swimming pool on the roof and lovely rooftop restaurant. Was so nice and romantic my partner proposed and I accepted!

title: moto gp
review: Lovely hotel in Florence.  Really nice room, very comfortable, nice shower and bath. The food is decent and the restaurant is located on the top floor.  Great view for your dining pleasure. Very pleasant and friendly staff!  Good location for all the attractions.

title: Four fantastic nights in Florence
review: hotel is quite convenient to train station makes it a good base, it's clean and comfortable, staff are helpful, roof terrace is a nice touch, food was just ok probably not if the cost is considered. .all and all does what it says on the tin.

title: Over nighter
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella.
