The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Would happily stay here again
review: Very pleasant smallish hotel near the river Arno and within easy walking distance of the major attractions. Stunning view over the city at dusk. Food less impressive. Would certainly consider for a short stay but not sufficiently equipped for a longer time.

title: A nice hotel in Florence
review: Stayed here for a few days after a wedding in Lucca last year. Location wise this hotel is out of the main tourist areas so not suitable if you are not prepared to walk. Its also just by the river which is great as you can walk into central Florence by the river. Probably about 10 minute walk to the Duma etc.  Positives: Great parking concierge service Big Rooms Rooftop restaurant with views of Florence especially in the evening Good food both breakfast (included) and evening meals Friendly staff  Negatives: Pool area on the roof is very small and bit tired as are the rooms but more than acceptable since we are in Florence  Would happily stay here again when in Florence

title: Short Stay at Kraft hotel May 2016
review: We recently returned from a 6 night stay at the Kraft Hotel. Upon arrival we were given an upgrade on the 1st floor but unfortunately there was extensive work on the neighboring building so we were unable to have the window open ,therefore little outside light. We enjoyed being in the quiet neighborhood near the river and the terrace and pool area were very nice with a gorgeous view of Florence. We also enjoyed the wide variety of food at the breakfast buffet. The hotel is well kept and the staff very friendly.

title: Superb hotel, quiet and within easy walk to the city centre
review: Location. In a "quiet" tidy residential area that is only 10 minutes walk from the central train station. To walk to the main historic central area will take about 15 /20 minutes of pleasant walk!!  About 4 minutes walk from the River!!  Rooms: We stayed in a Superior double room on the 4th Floor. The room was large with a lovely little balcony and outside seating, perfect for soaking up the late afternoon sun!! The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were lovely and soft!! The bathroom was large and very well equipped. Small kettle and a few sachets of coffee or tea are provided but these are not replenished everyday so take your own to be sure. There was a small but useful fridge in the room and a medium small flat screen TV with various satellite stations including BBC…

title: Five great nights
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Mixed experiences
review: From May 8 to 13, my wife and I had a tremendous experience at the Kraft hotel. Not only were the front desk people welcoming, courteous and helpful (one offered to arrange a change in our transfer pick-up time to allow us to have breakfast on the final day), but also the servers in the restaurant were extremely friendly and efficient. At breakfast, Roberto was always welcoming and served the best cappuccinos we had throughout Italy. The 6th floor terrace offered indoor and outdoor dining, and the views of Florence were stunning, especially at night. Our room was clean, quiet and well-serviced by the room attendant. Although the hotel is a 15-20 minute walk to the central tourist area (recommended by our travel agent), it is located in a quiet neighbourhood near the Arno river…

title: Nice visit
review: I have stayed at Kraft on three occasions. The last of these I was given a horrible room on the ground floor which was quite noisy as it was next to the street. On other occasions, my rooms have been better. Breakfast could be better and somewhat limited. Otherwise staff are friendly, and the rooftop has a lovely view.

title: Wonderful rooftop bar and restaurant
review: The Kraft Hotel is lovely. The hotel staff went out of their way to accommodate our group. Clean rooms, nice breakfast, and lovely roof top to enjoy a drink in the evening. A nice quiet location away from the busy tourist area.  Good value for the price.

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: We did not stay at the hotel but went to the rooftop bar and restaurant several times as we were staying across the street at a hotel that did not have a restaurant.  The views are wonderful at dusk and night.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Our meals were prepared and served nicely.  I would probably stay at this hotel if we ever find ourselves in Florence again as several mentioned their rooms were nice.

title: Do not recommend
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Convenient quiet location.
review: I do not recommend hotel Kraft unless you're in Florence for a night or two. From my experience with four stars hotel, Kraft slightly deserves three stars. The rooms are small (for two it's kind of ok), the air conditioning does not work when it's freezing because it's set on cooling for some reason and it's not changeable. The wifi in the first floor barely works in the rooms and you have to go out to the lobby just to check the mail. The staff is not helpful, seems careless, barely speaks English. The beverages in the room were not refilled. The same goes for breakfast; no refill, although maybe it's for the best because the food is monotonous and tasteless.  In conclusion, you can find plenty of better hotels, closer to the center of Florence and at the same price. Have a…

title: Hotel Kraft
review: The hotel is just outside of the centre in a quiet area near the river where there are many embassies. The rooftop terrace has a fabulous view. The pool was not open but it looks a bit small for swimming. Room spacious and clean. The only problem was that the bed was too hard for us and we did not sleep well. Florence was also a bit of a disappointment, even in March it was very full of tourists and all you can do is queue and pay, queue and pay, the buildings are generally plain and heavy and there don't seem to be many parks or public areas to sit and relax.

title: Good price and good location but a small bath
review: Thank you very much  Your review is higly appreciated .  Looking forward to welcoming you again,

title: Good choice and location
review: Generally the hotel was excellent, the staff without fail, polite and kind going that extra mile. The only down side was that room 122 needed a referb and was quite old and shabby though very clean. There was one evening where the Resturant service in the evening got very muddled and waited up to an hour and a half for our meal, having said that the staff were very good at keeping us entertained, so time passed quickly. Would certainly recommend as a quiet central place to stay with a great roof top Resturant/bar.

title: Hotel that offers great panoramic view of Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great room and good location
review: Location - This hotel is located not too far from the centre. It will take you 15-20mins walk to uffizi and ponte vechio and around 10 mins to duomo. It however is just a stone throw from the river hence you wouldn't fee that far walking from hotel to the attractions.   Attentiveness - I requested a quiet room in advance and was given a room just beside the front desk. The room doesn't come with the best sound proof walls hence it can get noisy when you have guests hanging around the lobby making noise.   Service - staff was friendly and knowledgable about the city. You could book many tours through them and they could sort it out for you.   Room - a bit dim and not the cleanest to be frank. It's kind of dusty (could be due to the ground floor unit) and small. However the high…

title: Good view - terribly loud chamber maids
review: We asked for a quad room as we were travelling with our 2 daughters so we expected to be crammed in a room usually for 2 but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was huge with a double bed and 2 singles (there was still room for my daughter to cartwheel across the middle of the room) and nicely decorated. The bathroom was really well equipped and spotless. The breakfast room on the top floor is lovely and there was a good choice of food for breakfast. The rooftop terrace has fantastic views and even at the end of March we were able to sit out having late afternoon drinks there. The hotel is located in a quiet street with a 15 minute walk along the river into the centre of Florence. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Not a four star, but also not a bad choice either.. but be ware it is noisy
review: Quite nice view from the terrace, very small rooms, but near to centro storico. Very loud chamber maids, they shout at each other on the hallway at 7am, regardless of whether you have hung the "please dont disturb" sign on the doorknob.

title: Really nice hotel, really nice location
review: We stayed here several days, it is not far from the center and also not far from the trainstation... all walking distance. It is not outdated, but also not very modern either. Still the room we had (at the front) was large enough, the same can be said for the bathroom.. we had a small balcony, it is clean, what more can you wish for?!...  The main concern is that it is very noisy, today we had a group of (chinese) teenage boys that can be heared several rooms and floors away.   The breakfast buffet is very basic, but "ok".. had better, but then again it has been a very long time ago that I slept in a hotel that in my eyes (and by Dutch and Indian standards) considered to be less than four stars.  Still it is clean, the staff is friendly and it is not too far from anything.

title: Wonderful stay, highly recommended
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Great stay, despite losing my phone
review: This was our first visit to Italy and Florence and Hotel Kraft was a perfect choice. The location is far enough away to be peaceful, but near enough that a 15 minute walk beside the river will get you to  the main area around Ponte Vecchio.  The staff are great ambassadors for Italy, friendly, warm and generous.  The roof terrace was wonderful both day and night and we were offered a blanket for the chilly March night. The continental breakfast was of a much higher standard than our next hotel in Rome.  As with all the buildings in Florence the hotel was old. The room could probably have done with being a bit bigger and the shower a bit more powerful, but if you want that either pay a lot more or go to those characterless, converted office blocks called Travelodge in England.…

title: Weekend Break in Florence
review: Stayed for 3 nights.  Hotel is in a great location, a pleasant walk away from the unmissable parts of Florence.  The rooms are great, lovely and clean, huge comfy bed and a bathroom with a bath (always a treat for me!).   There's a wonderful rooftop bar and restaurant. Cocktails up on the 5th floor is definitely something I could get used to.  It was still a bit chilly in March for sitting out but I can imagine how beautiful it will be in summer.  Unfortunately I had my brand new mobile phone stolen from our locked hotel room on the second night.  I was pretty upset but the manager could not have been more helpful and apologetic.  He personally accompanied us to the police station and even treated us to dinner one night to try and make amends.  The food in the restaurant is…

title: fabulous
review: Really nice hotel where the staff are very helpful and the rooms comfortable with tea/coffee facilities.  Breakfast was in the roof terrace restaurant which was lovely with lots of choices, and again the staff were very friendly and helpful.    We stayed at the beginning of March and the weather was not that warm, but the views from the terrace over Florence are brilliant and in warmer weather it would be a fabulous place to sit.  There is also a swimming pool on the roof which was empty during are stay, but for a summer visit would be great.  It takes about 20 minute to walk into the centre so take some good walking shoes or perhaps check out the buses/taxis.  Lots to see and as the train station is a short distance from the hotel we managed a trip to Pisa while we were there. …

title: Great customer care
review: absolutely loved it very central to town staff very nice and helpfull cant fault it excellent breakfast and the views from the restaurant over the city are breath taking within easy walking distance from central station and centre of town

title: Value for money
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Well situated hotel by the river.
review: The standard rooms do not look as nice as shown in the pictures of the website and you could hear the room next to you but overall it wasn't too bad. The breakfast is served at the top floor and has a good view. There are good choices but we found some of the cutlery not very clean. The coffee machine is not working well either. Recommend you to walk to the centre via along the river. Some nice restaurants with reasonable price not far from the hotel.

title: Esperienza Italiana
review: The hotel is perfectly adequate, the rooms are a good size, very clean and the reception staff are very pleasant and helpful.   The wifi is diabolically slow.  The food in the restuarant is not good, it probably fares badly in comparison with all the fabulous options available in Florence town itself, but it's really not good.  The serving staff are slapdash, and although pleasant, are not trained to the level I would expect for a four star hotel.   Don't eat there in the evening- go anywhere else- I promise you will have a better meal. And DON'T order breakfast in your room. Badly done and served in stages - cold coffee with your raw eggs anyone?  All that said, nice rooms and well situated by the river. Just be aware of its short comings.

title: A Very Pleasant Stay
review: We stayed here in November 2014, but got delayed in reviews :) We stayed here for two nights while in Florence, Italy. This hotel offered a truly Italian experience. Our room was elegant with high ceilings. The view out the shuttered window gave you a view of Italian lifestyle. The longe was quite nice and the employees were VERY helpful. They even took the time to offer suggestions on places to eat, provide maps, and book reservations for us for sightseeing tours. The roof top terrace had an EXCELLENT view of Italy. The location was within walking distance of everywhere. About a 6 or 7 block walk to Ponte de Vecchio. We liked that the hotel was "green" and the room card turned the lights on when there and off when not there.

title: Great place to stay, good location too!
review: We are from Brisbane Australia - stayed in room 159 between Jan 18 to Jan 24.  We initially booked this hotel for 4 nights, but we later extended our stay to 6 nights.  This hotel is located in a very quiet location in the central districts and everything was within walking distance.  All the staffs were very kind and friendly.  The breakfast was very well cooked and the restaurant was great (I had dinner there almost every night).  Room was very cleaned and housekeeping was excellent.  The wifi was free.

title: Beautiful
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location
review: we did have a very small room, but it came with a beautiful balcony so it equalled out. Lovely hotel. Lovely reception area and also an amazing rooftop, the bar was lovely too. I cAn imagine this hotel being even better in the summer. If I was to go back to Florence I would stay here again.

title: Four star farce
review: The hotel was located in easy walking distance to main attractions. The rooms are of average size, but have high ceilings which give the impression of a larger room. The breakfast was an added plus -- good choice with a lovely view of the city. There is also a rooftop pool that we weren't able to enjoy because of our winter stay. The staff is helpful and friendly.

title: Excellent stay
review: Positives: clean bed and towels. Breakfast ok. Quiet area.  Negatives: room reeked of smoke and corridor also very smokey. Room very noisy from maintenance work and very noisy guests above. Room decor shabby, carpet very badly marked. Shower soaked bedroom on every use. No replenishment of bathroom supplies or tea/coffee

title: Very nice location, great view
review: We visited Florence for four days in September 2015.  The Kraft is excellently situated for a gentle stroll to all of the main highlights in the town centre and not far from the river (so it's easy to find your way back as well!). Staff were really helpful and pleasant, drinks and food reasonably priced and the open terrace on the roof is a great place to sit in the sun with a cold drink for a an hour or so. Overall we really enjoyed staying here and would use the hotel again if ever we returned to Florence.  The rooms are a bit old fashioned, but done with style and well maintained and add to the charm.

title: Gem on the Arno
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: In a quiet area
review: I was very happy staying at this hotel. It's located a block off the Arno River and is a mere 10 minute walk to Sta Maria Novella rail station.  It's close enough to walk to all the major attractions of this marvelous city. We went off-season (January) and had the place pretty much to ourselves. Our room was right off the elevator on the 2nd floor and was enormous. We had a lovely balcony to sit on as well. The staff was fine, if a bit stiff. Breakfast was better than average.  They were in the midst of adding on to the top of the building, so you should be able to now request a room with a view of the river, which I would definitely do.  Can't go wrong with Kraft.

title: A place to remember
review: This hotel is within walking distance to the river and the main attractions and yet it is in a quiet area.  It has rooftop dining and good food.  The lobby is nice and the staff is friendly and helpful with advice on local restaurants and directions.  I left my iPhone there and they handled shipping it back to me in the USA at only the cost of shipping it.  The room was good size.  The bed was comfortable.  Free wifi in the rooms.  I do recommend this hotel!

title: A lovely place to stay
review: This is a very decent hotel, to which one would love to return at the end of a touring day. This first sentence is probably the essence of successful hoteling. Actually not only that, but one would like to cut his touring day a couple of hours into daylight, and return to enjoy the last hour or 2 of daylight in the beautiful roof terrace overlooking the magnificent vesta of Florence and the glimmering lights of the setting sun over its rooftops, enjoying a cup of coffee, a drink or a fine cigar.  Location is in a leafy street on the edge of tourist center, 1 small block to the Arno river, 7 minutes walk to the santa novella train station, 15-20 minutes to uffizzi gallery. I preferred to do all the walks along the beautiful Arno river.  A classical building, nice comfortable…

title: good
review: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights while on Florence. It is a lovely 15 minute walk along the river to the center Florence.  Our room had a balcony which provided us a great view of the courtyard which was quiet and pleasant.         The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable, the rooms neat and clean, and the beds extremely comfortable. We highly recommend this hotel for visitors to Florence.

title: Great Hotel for the Money
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Small friendly hotel with large rooms
review: Large rooms and bathroom. Also, all of the staff was excellent.  The upstairs panoramic view from roof bar and pool is incredible. 10 minute walk to main area in Florence. Low vehicle traffic flow so very quiet. It is a 12 minute walk to train station too.

title: Amazing!!
review: We stayed here at the beginning of November, my daughter had a single room whilst my wife and I had a double room, both rooms were large and spacious with balconies. The staff were very friendly and efficient, breakfast was very good, although our evening meal was slightly expensive for what it was. The hotel is in easy walking distance of both the station and the main attractions, so we did not need a car or public transport. We did not use the roof top pool, but the views of the sunset from there are spectacular.

title: excellent hotel
review: The best place to stay at in Florence!  We really enjoyed our stay in Hotel Kraft. I would seriously recommend anyone considering to stay in Florence to choose this hotel. The view from the roof top terrace is breathtaking! I cannot speak highly enough of it. The best spot in town. We spent there 3 nights from 4th of October,and luckily the swimming pool was still open. The staff is lovely, and breakfast was very nice! There is a lovely choice of cold cuts,and coffee was nice, too. The manager at breakfast was very friendly and attentive. Our bathroom was very spacious,and modern. We would definitely stay here again.  The only downside was the slow wifi, and the room would need some update. Walls in the room should be re-painted, and the wardrobes changed. Otherwise everything…

title: Italy Bus Tour
review: Hotel is very good with excellent breakfast and very good location. I am happy with the room size and bedding. I only had complain about the wifi in the room. I need to come out of the room or close to the door to get wifi access. IF it was not for WIFI, I would have rated it as 5 start.

title: good choice
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Around Europe
review: The hotel is in a great location for a holiday in Florence.  Very helpful and friendly staff, together with a lovely roof area to eat and observe the panoramic view.  The hotel is very clean, stylish and well kept.  Staff are helpful and their English is very good.  I highly recommend Hotel Kraft to anyone who is thinking of visiting Florence.

title: Great midrange hotel in a quiet neighborhood in Florence
review: Great place to stay. Would come back. Staff was attentive. Got ground floor some noise at night but ok.  Would request higher up when booking.  My son and I felt very safe. The terrace for breakfast was so impressive

title: fantastic hotel, great staff
review: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a big family celebration. because we were such a big group there were many small details to organize such as different size rooms to accommodate specific needs, renting the meeting room, making reservations for 21 people at restaurants, reserving multiple taxis at once, etc... the staff in this hotel is absolutely amazing. starting from the people at the desk who are efficient, friendly and knowledgeable, to the head waiter at the restaurant who is super sweet and even took our kids to tour the kitchen and meet the chef. To Elisabeta the events manager who made sure we had everything needed in the room for the party, to the cleaning people that wear a smile on their face while they prepare your room. The hotel is situated on a quiet street…

title: Great place
review: Some people say this place is a little far from the historic centre of Florence...not so if you enjoy a max 20 minute walk along the river or through the fascinating back streets.  The hotel is modern, the rooms are very clean and well managed. The breakfast is great and the staff very friendly and attentive. The panoramic roof terrace provides great views over Florence to enjoy over a glass of Chianti. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Great value, great stay.

title: Great Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Excellent Hotel
review: Great hotel close to train station. They upgraded me to a bigger room. Gave me a free drink on the bar. Very clean and friendly staff. I needed a taxi and they call a taxi company with a fixed price and it was great.   The good: location, cleanliness, friendly and efficient staff, rooms are great, free storage.  The bad: I can't think of anything.  I like this hotel and would stay here again. My rating would be 9.5 of 10

title: Average
review: Dear Guest,  We thank you very much for your feed back left after your stay at The Kraft Hotel.  In the hope to welcome you again we remain with our warmest regards .

title: Delivered all it promised
review: This is a great hotel in a convenient location, very accessible from the main station and along the Lungarno into the main sites within a 15 minute walk.  The room was clean and tidy and whilst we did experience a minor issue it was swiftly and efficiently dealt with once were informed the desk staff.  The breakfast offered a good variety and was well staffed.  The toaster worked a bit slow and queues generally formed but that was not something that put me off.  The staff in general are excellent and polite, with the absolute exception of the young Peruvian who thinks that we didn't notice his ignorant, sarcastic, disingenuous, insulting and belittling comments aimed towards us, thinking he was smart.  Well we did, we just chose not to cause a scene.  For this reason I would not…

title: bene
review: Located a solid 20 min walk from most sights in the Center of Florence we were disappointed .  Although we loved the exercise  , we tired of walking back  and forth and taking cabs- This hotel seems to serve locals and groups.  It honestly felt like a dormitory at first with  sparse  corridors and  pergo / parquet floors.  We had to move our first room as it was part of a suite entrance to a two room suite and the separating wall was paper thin.  A very noisy neighbor made us most uncomfortable... To the managers credit they moved us right away to a "free upgrade.... "Well the room was nicer from a decorative standpoint and had a balcony. but it was  directly under the 5th floor restaurant  , chairs dragging and high heels till 11 then again during breakfast.  We were completely…

title: Great Rooftop!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great hotel to visit Firenze AND relax by the pool at the end of the day...
review: Nice old hotel.  Our room was on the first floor and was large.  A little walk to shopping and you can find some nice local restaurants close to hotel.  Don't miss the rooftop restaurant and lounge.  Nice place to relax and have a glass of vino after sightseeing and shopping.  Florence is beautiful.  We stayed 2 nights with a Globus Tour.

title: Quiet neighborhood!!!   Very nice rooms, great breakfasts!
review: This hotel is a little bit on the outskirts of Firenze (max 10 min walk), but it offers a magnificient terrace to have breakfast or dinner. Also, there is a pool on the rooftop, deckchairs and shade, so at the end of a long day, it's wonderful to relax there. The views are breathtaking. The breakfast is perfect. The only downside is the A/C, not strong enough: we had to open the windows. Fortunately, the streets are quiet. Also, the staff is very helpful and all you have to do to park your car is hand your keys: they manage everything for you!

title: fantastic experience
review: The rooms are small by US standards but perfectly spotless, well appointed, very nice bathrooms. We loved the location because it's so much quieter than other places. Parking is done by the hotel's valet only and it isn't cheap, but it's by far the easiest!  Good restaurants and cafes are within a block or two.

title: Perfect location
review: Beautiful roof top view! Excellent location and the staff was always helpful! The rooms were very comfortable and the entire hotel is very clean. The breakfast buffet had tons of choices and was delicious. An overall lovely hotel.

title: Nice, Clean Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Ideal Hotel for Short Stay
review: Friendly staff, clean rooms, good for short stay.  A lot of construction going on so hard to get there.  Staff helped with tours etc.  Away from crowds, but too far to walk to train station, so need a bus or taxi.  Loved the hotel terrace for view and service.

title: Wonderful Accommodations
review: Excellent Location away from the crowded areas. Very good staff especially in the wonderful rooftop restaurant. Didn't use the swimming pool but looked a useful facility. Would use again if in the area.

title: friendly staff but hotel needs a good upgrade
review: The breakfast staff was very attentive with specific thanks to Roberto, Ray, and Irene. In particular, Roberto took very good care of us. The front desk was extremely good with directions and bus connections.

title: Short break
review: Dear Guest,  We thank you very much for your feed back left after your stay at The Kraft Hotel.  In the hope to welcome you again we remain with our warmest regards .

title: Brilliant
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Awful Check In Experience
review: My Fiance and I stayed at Hotel Kraft for 4 nights this September and we had a wonderful experience.  Check in was smooth and friendly and during the whole stay all the staff we encountered couldn't do enough for us. The facilities were in very good condition, our room was lovely and we had a balcony which was a bonus.  The roof top terrace and pool were worth every penny and the restaurant was brilliant... really delicious food and great service.  The hotel is only 5-10 minutes walk to the centre of Florence and so is the perfect place to stay.  All in all we had a wonderful stay at Hotel Kraft, we would recomend it to anyone visiting Florence and we will definately be staying again.

title: Lovely hotel with roof terrace
review: On arrival we were informed there was no on-site parking and we had to pay 22 euros/day for the off-site service the hotel provided.  Unfortunately that had not been made clear by the company we booked with.  Despite demonstrating this via our booking, the Receptionist offered no acknowledgment  of the problem and instead took great joy in insisting we should have known.  She set about providing evidence of the charge by repeatedly showing us booking forms (we had never been sent) and websites (we hadn’t used) which mentioned this charge.    Frustrating as this was we tried to put it behind us, checked in and proceeded to our room (which we had been advised was a ‘good room’ as we were on honeymoon).  It stank of smoke.  When arriving back in Reception to inform the hotel of the…

title: The first big ‘Wow!’ moment of our short but busy holiday...
review: Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. I must admit, when we checked on after a trip from Venice into our room I was a little disappointed. It seemed far from the centre, the beds were single and there were road works going on outside.  However...we called reception who promptly arranged our beds to cons together. I then understood that the road works were nothing to do with the hotel, and finally, the location was a blessing and not a curse! The walk to the centre took only 10 minutes and it was a straight walk along the River Arno. We felt perfectly safe (you are close to the U.S. consulate) and the are is nice. What's more the restaurant quality is better here, further along the road (to the rear) is the Papier Rossi which is a great place.  We didn't eat a main meal here but the…

title: Roof top magic.
review: Disembarking the train in Florence we were met by a wall of heat: fortunately, though, the hotel was very easy to find and within easy walking distance of the station – 10 minutes’ gentle stroll in the hot sun. And on reaching its elegant, tree-lined location you would never have guessed you could be so close to the bustle of the city.  Check-in was quick, friendly and efficient, and our ground floor room excellent. Adjustable A/C soon cooled it to our preferred temperature as we investigated TV, charging points, room safe and bathroom. All good, especially the traditional bath with shower incorporated. The free wi-fi did exactly what it said on the tin.  Only a minutes’ walk in the other direction is the River Arno and a pleasant promenade into the main tourist area. After…

title: Come here for the rooftop terrace
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice stay in Florence
review: Plus: Amazing view from rooftop terrace, clean, quiet neighborhood.  Minus: A lot of noise from hallway - woke me up in the middle of the night, breakfast buffet could be better, food in hotel restaurant is not good, but used the bar several times. Slow service. Wifi quality not the best

title: Honeymoon
review: Hotel Kraft is a nice boutique hotel in Florence. The hotel is located a short walk from the train station and you can follow the river down to the city centre. The rooms are small but pleasant; bathrooms are clean; reception is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is on the 5th floor and has spectacular views over the city. The service at breakfast needs to be improved. The staff need to be more efficient with attending to guests as they arrive and also with replenishing all breakfast items. Overall, the stay at Hotel Kraft was pleasant.

title: Great hotel in good location
review: Stopped at this hotel for three days as part of our honeymoon trip around Italy. Would highly recommend it, close/walking distance to central Florence. Good sized bedroom, pool on the roof terrace is exactly where you want to be after a hot Florence day spent sight seeing. Breakfast buffet was good with a full continental selection. Will happily return!

title: Superb Hotel With Excellent Disabled Facilities
review: Great hotel, very well appointed rooms, modern and comfortable. Good WiFi,  good food, good staff! Bedroom with small balcony, ideal for that pre-dinner drink. Best beds we have found on our travels so far, soft pillows for a change! Really enjoyed our four days here, no complaints at all. First class, well recommended.

title: Brillent Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good Location, Great Breakfast!
review: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our holiday in Tuscany and enjoyed every minute of it. Brilliant hotel with great facilities. The weather was very hot so we were out every morning early having enjoyed a beautiful breakfast to see the sights and looked forward to coming back to the beautiful outdoor pool to relax for the afternoon. Staff, room, bar,  food & pool, was all great. I will be recommending this hotel and if I have reason to be back I will definitely stay here again

title: Skyline view of Florence
review: We stayed here for the first three nights of our trip. Room was clean. The furniture a bit worn. The pool on top of the hotel is great after a day of sightseeing and you have a great view of the city. Close to everything but very quiet street. One front desk staff very unfriendly but the rest of the staff were nice, especially Roberto. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious.

title: Clean and friendly staff
review: This hotel gets a strong rating for its rooftop restaurant/bar and a swimming pool too, as well as its convenient short walk to the heart of Florence.  The breakfasts are top notch!  Excellent service from restaurant staff.  The night time ambiance on the roof are the best with a view of roof tops and domes of churches.  Our room had a view of another building (overlooking the front of our hotel) But room was clean and comfortable, small by US standards but typical of Europe.  Hotel is conserving energy and hall lights will come on as you enter.  Rooms also require the room key be inserted in a power slot to turn on lights and windows must be closed to enable the AC to work.  Problematic is with only one key, when we leave the room, the power to the outlets also turns off and…

title: Fantastic hotel for a relaxed visit to Florence
review: The hotel is very clean. Rooms are small but comfortable. We took a taxi to central Florence but you can walk if you want to. Free breakfast included. Good selection of cold cuts, fruits, pastries, and crackers. Breakfast Host, Roberto, is the most amazing employee in this hotel. He is very friendly and helpful. He prepares the best cappuccino in the world!

title: Great Staff. Good food. Clean Room.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Tour of Florence- awesome!
review: I would definitely visit here again. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is good for all places of interest and near to the river. The bedRoom was adequately sized and my son said his chair bed was very comfortable. The rooftop pool was a very small but welcome addition at the end of a long day sightseeing.

title: Great terrace and value for the price
review: Such a cute and perfect hotel for Florence!!! I searched on trip advisor for a great place to stay. 6 months and prior they had some reviews that needed to work on some building updates and customer service, but more recent reviews said they were  great so I gave them a shot! I loved it! If they had any issues before they were all fixed and fantastic with the building. Our room was so cute and with a great balcony. Everyday breakfast was complimentary on the roof deck terrace with such a friendly staff. The food spread was rather large and great international food choices.   My only slight negative comment is I would ask the front desk staff to smile more (they looked annoyed most of the time) and greet the guests whenever they'd see them (sometimes they'd look at you but say…

title: Nice hotel staffed by a selection of very helpful, very friendly and very polite staff.
review: Hotel was walking distance to the heart of the city. Very clean and friendly staff. Not a luxury hotel but an amazing value for the price. The free breakfast buffet on the terrace is AMAZING. Made the hotel experience. Great value for a relatively affordable option :)

title: Comfortable Hotel
review: The hotel is located in a quiet spot 10 mins from the train station near to the American consulate. Main lanmarks are roughly a pleasant 15 minute stroll along the river. Reception staff are helpful, décor is pleasant. Room was clean and air conditioning worked OK. View from room onto the street was a little non desript. Breakfast is served on the rooftop, inside or outside. The Maitre D organising everyone has a great character and is very friendly. Breakfast is a good selection of standard fare, well presented. The bar area and pool area are the hotels best point, perched high looking over the terracotta roofs towards the main attractions and Tuscan countryside. Slight Vertigo problems to one side, this was very relaxing and enjoyable. The barman on the rooftop bar was…

title: Lovely holiday
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Very nice hotel
review: My husband and I booked to stay here to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary. The hotel was exceptionally comfortable...we upgraded to a superior room to enhance our stay with a balcony. The facilities were faultless. However what impressed us most was the excellent restaurant on the 6th floor. The breakfast was impressive with a wide selection on offer....and the staff were very attentive. The restaurant in the evening served the most delicious food whilst the spectacularview enhanced the whole experience. The cheesecake was second to none!!!! Lastly the ability to relax and cool off at the pool made our holiday the relaxing break we hoped for. Thank you to all the staff.  Would highly recommend this hotel!!!!

title: Very friendly hotel
review: We stayed for four nights at this hotel with my family. We enjoyed our stay a lot. The rooms are quite nice and the beds are comfortable. Staff are friendly and courteous. The location is also very good, quite close to the railway station, yet tucked away is a nice quiet lane.

title: Honeymoon
review: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in August 2015. The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. The man who managers the breakfast, had a great sense of humour and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was 157 on the ground floor, it was a bit tired but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was also dark but it was cooler and if we wanted a view, the roof top terrace was a perfect way to relax after a day seeing the sights. Drinks were very reasonably priced and the man who managed the afternoon bar was also really friendly and made great cocktails.  Overall a good hotel for the money - I would be happy to stay there again

title: Perfect For Short Break
review: We are on our honeymoon, travelling Across Tuscany. This is the best hotel so far. The prices are ok, the service is great and the food and drinks Are awesome.  We got a suite with balcony, which had afternoon Sun. The roof top deck with pool is perfect for relaxing with a bottle of proseccco in the Sun White enjoying the wiew over The city.

title: Clean, bright with a gorgeous roof view
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Top of the world.....
review: I still can't believe we managed to find a hotel like this in Italy. I have been all over the country, visited many times and have seen some beautiful and not so beautiful hotels. However, this one stands out, and what a breath of fresh air!!!  It was a welcome surprise to step into such a crisp, clean hotel cleverly designed with a comfortable modern aesthetic, in a way that maintains respect for tradition.  I brought some florentine friends over and they couldn't believe their eyes either.  Our room was huge and full of sunlight. We had a great view and two sets of French doors to a private small furnished balcony. The a/c and air filtration system offered such relief from the hot and smoker-filled city.  As if that's not enough, there's the roof...a magical place to get a…

title: Off the beaten path, but with reach
review: A well located friendly hotel, situated with walking distance to the centre of Florence. The hotel could do with some investment, the bedroom furniture and soft furnishings are basic and tired. However, the staff compensate for this.  The breakfast is good, and the staff manager amusing, slightly 'Manuel' in character.

title: fantastic
review: Kraft Hotel is in a residential area of Florence. 1 block from the Arno river, just by the USA Consolate. You won't be in the heart of the action, but a quick cab ride or about 15 min walk you are in the dead center of the city.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Wonderful location!  Quiet and  close to river.  Easy walk to hop on hop off bus and easy walk to town.  Staff was amazing and helpful. Beautiful location on roof top for breakfast every morning with delightful staff and nice variety of breakfast items. Wonderful place for dinner and to watch the sunset overlooking the city.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Very Disappointing
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Great stay!
review: My mother and I chose to stay here based on the great reviews. We were sorely disappointed. We stayed at three hotels during our trip to Italy--one in Venice, one in Rome, and this one in Florence. This one was the most of expensive of the three, and yet it was the only one where our stay was not enjoyable. The ONLY pro is delicious breakfast on the roof. Don't bother with the dinner restaurant there. When we first checked in, they gave us a handicap room, so we had them change us to a normal room. The beds were hard, the WiFi connection was weak. The tub in the cramped bathroom was surrounded by rotting wood and cracked tiles. Two light bulbs were out, the air conditioning was weak, and the fridge didn't work. The safe is opened using a key from the front desk, which is less…

title: Less than Expected
review: We stayed here at the beginning of July. Everything about this hotel was exactly what we wanted. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the food was delicious and the views from the roof terrace were fantastic! There are only two hotels in Florence with a rooftop pool and it was a great added bonus. I would definitely recommend staying here if you want to stay in the heart of Florence!

title: Great. Just great
review: This hotel seems to be family owned by Swiss and they are looking to pinch pennies. The air conditioning was not really cooling by room. The ceiling starting leaking big time one night. The handyman opened the large patch in the ceiling and said it was the AC. He did nothing but closed the hole in the ceiling and used a bath towel to mop up water on the parquet squares. The next AM, the same handyman painted the ceiling. So it is only a matter of time before it happens again. I also faced the street and heard all the street noise. I did not like the neighborhood.  The hotel catered to groups, specifically "Globus" and "Road Scholars". After they ate breakfast, not much left.  The roof deck was nice. Chairs under a "thatched" area provided shade, there was also about 10 chaises.…

title: Perfect stay in Firenze and Hotek Kraft
review: Hotel in Firenze. The staff is anxious to assist you. The room is what was requested. One large bed. Lots of closet space. Air conditioning works. Large bathroom with shower. Very good location. A healthy walk to any piazza. Restaurants and upscale shopping just a few minutes away. No need for a taxi. Walk...  Rooftop pool. Lovely breakfast and lots of electrical outlets. Bring your proper power adapter. Enjoy yourself.

title: Great place with a roof top pool
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: window opening to the street is lovely,
review: What's to say about this hotel, I stayed there with my family and the real bonus was the roof top pool (although small) and lounge. After a long day of absorbing the beauty that Florence has to offer it was great to get back have a beer and relax with the fantastic views over the city! The rooms are comfortable and Italian so not an English style 4 star hotel standard but I have no complaints. Breakfast was a good selection of both continental and English and I didn't want for more. As for its location it is brilliant a 10 minute walk in to the heart of Florence along the river bank. There is valet parking at an extra charge but you can't park anywhere near the hotel otherwise, I think it was 10 euro a day. All in all a nice hotel

title: Not an easy walk from train station
review: overall pretty decent hotel for the price location is a bit blind spot but not far. if you are looking for a decent hotel with a decent budget this is the place. didnt do much with the staff except for the kettle we asked for which they brought pretty soon.

title: Great hotel
review: I had expected this to be an easier walk from the hotel, but it was not.  Once we got there only one room out of there was ready, which we expected because we were early.  We dumped all of our luggage in one room and set out exploring.  We were much further from the city center than I would have liked, and we walked through a kinda shady neighborhood to get to the city center.   We were a little disappointed because in the evenings we like to drink some wine and play cards, but there wasn't any place that we could do this.  There is a bar in the lobby, but they asked us to not drink our own wine in there, it would have been okay if we would have bought wine from them though. Also, disappointed in the quality of the WiFi, it was almost not even there in the rooms.

title: Nice hotel good located
review: Great hotel the bar and pool on the roof have spectacular views of Florence. We had a suite with balcony and the room was cool, quiet and beds comfortable. The hotel is right near the American consulate and so traffic is cut off so makes the area really quite (for Florence), but on the downside it's slightly out the way however the hotel is in a very nice neighbourhood and right next to the river. The only other downside was the bar was overpriced and the breakfast was basic and coffee poor quality from the machines. But these are small niggles.

title: City Center
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: They are really working Towards a MUCH nicer experience
review: I chose this hotel because of its vicinity to the center of the historic Florence. I later learned that I was one block from the US Consulate. The hotel was pure luxury and with the roof top restaurant and pool what a better way to spend and afternoon than sipping drinks or floating in the pool.

title: Mwah!  Super find in Florence.
review: I feel a little bit of a snob in only offering them 3-stars.  The staff was very friendly and kind and the accommodation was actually ideal for our entire family.  There is just room for improvement, and they are working hard. Each of the mornings we found people actively working to improve the Hotels infrastructure.    Their location to great, an easy walk from the train station and all the major sites in Florence.  Our room was much more than we expected and was very comfortable for the 4 of us.  The shower was a bit tricky to be sure not the soak the floor.  The breakfast was ideal for our family and the kids loved the roof top pool!

title: We liked it...BUT....not a lot.........
review: Second hotel on our trip in Italy. Hotel Alimandi  was our first hotel for Rome. Beautiful. And now hotel Kraft for Florence. Arrived a few hours ago and I'm super impressed. Staff is very friendly, speaks good English.  Everything is clean, with large rooms and air conditioning. Priced excellent. Located close to everything, yet tucked away in a quaint little neighborhood not in tourist trap location. Homemade pasta for lunch and gorgeous view on their terrace while you eat and then up to the pool for even better view of the entire city. Wonderful boutique hotel. Reminds me of the "Grand Park" in London England. Would highly recommend.
